q: In his remarks, Lomax touched on the critical role education plays in living out Martin Luther King 's dream.`` Among the rights Martin Luther King fought for was the right to an education,'' he said. But his life was tragically cut short before he could lead us in the fight to afford the college education we needed, and the right to attend public schools that would prepare us to gain admission to and graduate from the colleges we had the legal right to attend. That battle he left for us. The breakfast got its start when UNCF and the Colin Powell Mills Foundation joined together to host a community celebration to honor the legacy of Martin Luther King . What started with 800 guests in 1991 now has grown to be

.`` I genuinely on an hourly basis want to teach myself that this is what can happen when you're successful is that you start to believe your own hype,'' he explained. Then you start living in this bubble, which is your world, and you start to believe that that's the only world that exists. Which is why most successful people screw it up for themselves normally within two, three, five, ten years. Because they stop listening. The biggest failures I've had were at a time when I believed my own hype. Simon Cowell famously persuaded British actors Robson Green and Jerome Flynn to sign a recording contract, after they sang together on a UK TV show. Their rendition of Unchained Melody was phenomenally successful, but Simon Cowell has revealed it

was at the game.... Mike D'Antoni said he stayed up late Thursday to watch Stoudemire on the Late Show with David Letterman , where the All-Star told the host that the players do in fact listen to the coach. He doesn't listen to me, Mike D'Antoni said with a laugh.`` He was nice, though, very diplomatic.''

the unusual things teams are coming up with to defend Michael Vick .`` I think we're making good adjustments as players and coaches; I like to do that sooner than later,'' Reid said. We're getting some unique looks. Everybody has a certain way,[ defensively] that they're playing Michael Vick , and it's not your normal- it's hard to put on another tape and see teams do what they do to Michael Vick , they just change things up and throw you a little bit of a curveball. So you have to make some adjustments. You have to be able to do that. Sunday, the biggest adjustment seemed to be the offensive line finally sorting out the Giants' blitzes, giving Michael Vick a little time and room to work with, especially when he decided to run.

Bernie Sanders said in his letter that the nation's political climate had been damaged by a`` right-wing media echo chamber'' that is transmitting a reactionary world view to the tens of millions of millions of Americans who watch or listen to them every day. In a separate statement, state Republican Chairman Steve Larrabee said:`` By using this tragedy to demonize those he disagrees with, the Barack Obama is doing exactly what he pretends to deplore.''
